intro: Pycnospatha, commonly known as the mountain huckleberry, is a shrub native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries, which are edible, are typically dark purple or black when mature. Pycnospatha thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
